With Four Fingers, I can create a straight with four cards, but I can't make one with what I have—like 6-7-8-9 since I lack an 8. I also don't have enough cards for a flush. My best bet might be aiming for three of a kind with the 7s. However, I need to remember that three of a kind requires three specific cards and two kickers, while Balatro considers the best five cards in play for scoring. I'll keep calculating!
**Clarifying hand scoring**

If I play three 7s, along with a Q and a 9, I have a three of a kind with kickers. I'm pretty sure those kickers count in Balatro since the evaluation is based on all five cards played. For three of a kind, the hand includes the trips and the two kickers, which should score chips and trigger effects. In poker, a pair also uses five cards, so the same concept applies here—only the pair counts if I play just the pair. I'll keep pondering this!
**Calculating potential scores**

I need to play five cards to maximize chips and triggers, especially with my mult-enhanced cards. Right now, I only have two: 3♠ and 9♣, and I want them to be part of the highest hand. If I combine them with my three 7s, I'll have a three of a kind with kickers as 3♠ and 9♣. That gives me a solid hand, with both mult cards contributing +4 each. So let's estimate the score: starting with 30 plus the values of my cards. I’ll get a total of 63 chips before multipliers, and my total multiplier will be 11.
**Strategizing for card draw**

I need to score more chips and possibly set up a strong hand. With two mult cards, I should consider playing them wisely, maybe using just one to save the other for future hands. I have three hands left and need to aim for a straight flush, using my 9♣, 7♣, and 6♣. However, to achieve that, I need to play cards that don't use these clubs to draw new ones which could help complete my flush. My best approach might be to hold on to my clubs while playing non-club cards now.
**Planning card strategies**

I can still play 4 cards in a hand, but it might yield low chips. Should I sacrifice clubs or other cards to maximize draws? I could play trips with three 7s and a kicker while keeping my 9♣ for potential future plays. However, aiming for a pair of 9s might also be an option. I see that playing specific cards could help cycle through my hand and maintain potential for drawing valuable clubs, so I’ll prioritize keeping my club cards and play wisely.
**Calculating flush options**

To score a flush, I need the base chips, which are 35, with a base multiplier of 4, plus Mystic's 15, leading to a multiplier of 46. For a flush including 9♣, I'd calculate my card total plus the base: say if I have a 4-club flush with cards totaling 68, my score would be 68 times the multiplier. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
